t: Amazon brings Amazon Clinic, One Medical under a single brand
s: Amazon One Medical now offers customers two ways to get convenient, high-quality health care: Pay-per-visit telehealth for 30+ common conditions (like pink eye, the flu, or a sinus infection), or Membership where customers pay a monthly or annual fee for on-demand virtual care, easy booking ...

t: Amazon consolidates Amazon Clinic into the One Medical brand | TechCrunch
s: June 27, 2024 - Under the One Medical brand, Amazon is offering customers two options: a telehealth service for over 30 common conditions (such as acne, eczema, the flu, pink eye, seasonal allergies and a sinus infection), or a paid membership to get on-demand virtual care and next-day in-person appointments ...

t: Amazon Clinic expands nationwide to provide messaging and video visits for common health conditions
s: Last November, we introduced Amazon Clinic, a virtual health care marketplace that makes it easy for customers to quickly get the care they need for more than 30 common health concerns like urinary tract infections, pink eye, and erectile dysfunction.

t: Amazon Clinic
s: Get care from an in-person or online doctor or clinician and request prescriptions. Now offering ongoing primary care and 24/7 telehealth.

t: Amazon Clinic Is Now Amazon One Medical | Amazon One Medical
s: Yes. Amazon One Medical Pay-per-visit (formerly Amazon Clinic - clinic.amazon.com) still offers on-demand virtual treatment for common health conditions like erectile dysfunction (ED), urinary tract infections (UTIs), pink eye, strep throat, sinus infection, and many more.

t: Amazon consolidates Clinic telehealth service into Amazon One Medical offering
s: June 27, 2024 - Consumers also have the option of an Amazon One Medical membership based on a monthly or annual fee for on-demand virtual care and the ability to book same and next-day appointments at One Medical offices, according to an Amazon blog post on Thursday morning.

t: Amazon Folding 'Clinic' Brand Telehealth Business Into ...
s: August 27, 2024 - The online retail giant said Thursday it is putting the “Amazon Clinic” brand virtual health business under the Amazon One Medical brand.

t: Amazon One Medical | Telehealth & In-Person Visits | Primary Care
s: Get care from an in-person or online doctor or clinician and request prescriptions. Now offering ongoing primary care and 24/7 telehealth.

t: Amazon Health | In-Person/Online Urgent Care | Prescriptions
s: With telehealth, in-person care, and online prescriptions, Amazon Health is here to make it easier and more affordable to get and stay healthy.

t: Amazon Clinic - Wikipedia
s: January 4, 2025 - Customers in 34 states can use messaging to consult a medical clinician about 20 common conditions, such as acne, pink eye, migraine, and erectile dysfunction. Once the consultation is complete, patients have the option of filling any prescriptions through Amazon Pharmacy for home delivery.

t: Amazon Clinic integrates into the retail giant's One Medical offerings | MobiHealthNews
s: July 5, 2024 - In April, Walmart announced it will close clinics and end its virtual care program as costs mounted and reimbursement issues proved an intractable challenge. Tags: Amazon, One Medical, virtual care company, virtual care provider

t: Amazon Merges Clinic and Amazon One Medical Into Single Brand | PYMNTS.com
s: June 27, 2024 - Amazon’s pay-per-visit telehealth service and its One Medical program are now a single brand, renamed as Amazon One Medical Pay-per-visit.

t: Amazon consolidates Amazon Clinic into the One Medical brand
s: June 27, 2024 - Amazon is folding its Amazon Clinic telehealth service into its primary care business One Medical, the company announced on Thursday. The company explained in today's blog post that, to simplify Amazon’s primary care offering for customers, the service has now been rebranded to Amazon One ...

t: Introducing Amazon Clinic, a virtual health service that delivers convenient, affordable care for common conditions
s: November 15, 2022 - Amazon Clinic will operate in 32 states and provide virtual care for more than 20 common health conditions, such as allergies, acne, and hair loss.
